title: Japan’s SLIM Lunar Lander Notches More Successes
summary: The Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency confirmed today that the Smart Lander for Investigating Moon, or SLIM, achieved its primary objective of demonstrating pinpoint landing accuracy. By JAXA’s criteria, that alone […]

title: Firefly cleared to compete for National Reconnaissance Office launch missions
summary: Firefly Aerospace announced it will compete for launch services contracts from the National Reconnaissance Office under a new program set up by the agency to procure rides for its small satellites.

title: ESA Green Light Venus Probe and Gravitational Wave Observatory
summary:
The European Space Agency has given the green light to a pair of ambitious science missions that will be launched in the 2030s. During the agency’s Science Programme Committee meeting on 25 January, ESA officially adopted the LISA gravitational wave observatory and the EnVision Venus explorer. The successful adoption confirms that work can begin to […]
The post ESA Green Light Venus Probe and Gravitational Wave Observatory appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: EU space law proposal due in March
summary: The European Commission is preparing to release by March a draft of the first comprehensive European space law, although no one outside of the Commission is quite sure what it will include.

title: Daily Telescope: A stunning image of a star cluster in a nearby galaxy
summary: A bright young star within a colorful nebula.

title: Japan’s SLIM achieved pinpoint moon landing with just one working engine
summary: Japan’s SLIM lander achieved its goal of an accurate moon landing moon with only one of two main thrusters operating, JAXA stated Thursday.

title: Freedom Space’s ground network software selected for U.S. Space Force program
summary: Freedom Space Technologies, a subsidiary of Atlas Space Operations, is partnering with Omni Federal to develop a next-generation ground system for U.S. Space Force missile-warning satellites.

title: Exolaunch Wins €18M DLR Launch Contract
summary:
German space agency DLR has awarded an €18 million launch contract to Berlin-based Exolaunch. DLR awarded the contract on behalf of and with funds from the German Ministry of Economics and Climate Protection, and it will see the mission management startup oversee the launch of payloads from winners of the country’s Small Satellite and Small […]
The post Exolaunch Wins €18M DLR Launch Contract appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: ESA sees strong interest in commercial cargo program
summary: The European Space Agency sees strong interest from industry in a new initiative to support development of commercial cargo vehicles, a step towards a European human spaceflight capability.

title: IXPE investigates microquasar jets, finds unexpected magnetic field structure
summary: Creating some of the most powerful gravitational forces and fields in the universe, black holes are known for their extreme nature, including the ways in which they can devour and destroy whole planets and stars in a matter of seconds. When black holes consume planets, stars, and other cosmic objects, the matter from the collision between the two objects gets violently thrown around space — creating streams of particles traveling near the speed of light from black holes. These streams of particles are known as jets, and while scientists know that these jets can accelerate particles, known as cosmic rays, they know very little about the exact process by which the particles are accelerated.
